data.text:
.@WFP provides school meals to millions of children around the world, with long term benefits for: 

📚 Education
🍚 Nutrition & health
👧 Gender equality
🌾 Local economies

More on Thursday's International School Meals Day: https://t.co/mEb3Z3PC8e #ISMD2020 https://t.co/zwGftKqFLu
To tackle the impact of #COVID19 on education due to school closures, @UNESCO recommends the use of distance learning programmes. https://t.co/QUJ61YSzgS #Coronavirus https://t.co/okoTfC7FvP

#Coronavirus: To meet the health needs of over 70 million refugees worldwide, @Refugees appeals for $33 million to support its prevention and response efforts in refugee sites and host countries. https://t.co/qma924hagt #COVID19

An estimated 150 million girls will get married before their 18th birthday by 2030, if measures to prevent child marriage are not accelerated.

A multi-country initiative will help #EndChildMarriage and protect millions of girls. https://t.co/zciICeJgko https://t.co/xklRLJsuhN

Widespread breeding of desert locusts in Kenya, Ethiopia and Somalia represent an unprecedented threat to food security in the Horn of Africa.
Latest @FAO update: https://t.co/uLBgAuwAvS https://t.co/S1ZigXqE9Y

The #COVID19 pandemic is a crisis that affects everyone. 

We must all play our part by showing solidarity with the most vulnerable – the elderly, the sick, those without reliable healthcare.
- @antonioguterres on #coronavirus 

 https://t.co/TfVqVe3joy

Every 40 seconds, someone takes their own life. 

Find out what you can do if you think someone is considering suicide. https://t.co/7NIGk8vE9X https://t.co/EiWIxFukv0

#Coronavirus NEWS: @WHO characterizes #COVID19 as pandemic, but that does not change the threat level or recommended actions. 

This is a pandemic that can be controlled. 

More: https://t.co/tsGUhMZQ6s https://t.co/tH2PjMNKea

The Syria crisis has entered its 10th year. 

11-year-old Amina is one of the millions of people in the country struggling to survive amid hardship and desperation. https://t.co/7UTVQkl7CL #NotATarget via @unocha https://t.co/bTVPDaln8J

New guidance is out aimed at keeping students & teachers safe during the #coronavirus outbreak, while also preventing stigmatization. 

More from @UNICEF & @WHO on important steps for protecting schools. https://t.co/m6DkJepXKg

➡️ Call out sexism
➡️ Teach girls their worth 
➡️ Challenge beauty standards 

More tips from @UN_Women on how YOU can help achieve #GenerationEquality: 
https://t.co/npz6E8OJun https://t.co/gKyq3Uz0Ft
In Turkey, @WFP cash assistance programmes supported by the European Union have helped more than 1.7 million vulnerable refugees from Syria. https://t.co/JbbMGKIVVh https://t.co/xRrPXdBECL

Looking for job opportunities? 

The UN:
🔹 Does not charge fees for recruitment related processes
🔹 Does not ask for your bank information
🔹 Does not endorse any non-UN providers offering recruitment information or scholarships. 

More from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/J6VgGEYRTJ https://t.co/wShbitVmDs

Loving and accepting your #LGBTI kids = parenting done right! 

Join UN @free_equal and stand up for equal rights & fair treatment of lesbian, gay, bi, trans and intersex people everywhere. https://t.co/uGK1BARin9 https://t.co/aLQxdDLrGB

Women's equal and meaningful participation in peace processes is essential. 

This #WomensHistoryMonth, @UNPeacekeeping highlights women’s strength, leadership and invaluable contributions to lasting peace. https://t.co/ACiyEo3iR6 https://t.co/PEimQpK1hK

"We have no time to lose if we are to avert a climate catastrophe."

-- @antoniotoguerres on new @WMO #StateOfClimate report. https://t.co/5PxTqUrdTA #ClimateAction.

 https://t.co/tDyu7oElkP

UNHQ complex in NYC is currently closed to the public & guided tours are temporarily suspended as a preventative measure given the #coronavirus outbreak. 

Get updates from @VisitUN here: https://t.co/N5A7pWr40E https://t.co/cmEPZfQZCx

2019 was the 2nd hottest year on record.
The past decade was the hottest in human history.

More from @WMO on the impacts of the climate emergency and the urgent need for #ClimateAction in latest #StateofClimate report: https://t.co/5PxTqUrdTA https://t.co/iDLJmQKNS3

Watch live as @antonioguterres and @WMO chief Petteri Taalas release #StateOfClimate 2019 report, including latest updates on the climate crisis, extreme weather & more. #ClimateAction 

https://t.co/73en5ZXhqE

A simple act of kindness can change a person's life. 💖

See how you can show your support for @refugees 👉 https://t.co/4BRaoM52lP 

https://t.co/o0smmlHy9Q

Preventative steps at work can help address the #coronavirus outbreak:
➡️ Consider online meeting options
➡️ Provide tissues & hand sanitizer 
➡️ Arrange seats at least one metre apart
➡️ Keep meeting participants' contact details

More from @WHO: https://t.co/CXvJoO5GLH #COVID19 https://t.co/ocQ66O6h7H

Meet Birgitta Marais, who works with @UNMAS in Somalia, training explosive detection dogs. 🐕 

Details on the UN's efforts to create a world free of the threat of landmines and unexploded ordnance: https://t.co/cA3Umvsvst https://t.co/1hyYPpvnzV

On Monday at UNHQ, the #CSW64 Political Declaration was adopted, with particular focus on: 
➡️ Women in leadership & peace processes
➡️ Education
➡️ Economic empowerment
➡️ #ClimateAction
➡️ Right to health coverage 

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/gfUgrD5Wd3 https://t.co/McWpUKfQXj
In Papua New Guinea, @AminaJMohammed highlights the importance of empowering women and girls to reach the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/vAZp2BCoON #GenerationEquality https://t.co/QRYPrTRJq2

The number of young people unemployed & not in educational or training programmes is increasing, with women more than twice as likely to be affected than men.

New @ilo report has strategies to create decent jobs for young people: https://t.co/FLwU3iLf0i https://t.co/mbCWUkZNRL

The #coronavirus outbreak could cost the global economy up to $2 trillion this year.

@UNCTAD is calling on governments to take urgent steps to reduce the economic impact. https://t.co/bFGE9SZemC #COVID19 https://t.co/EUkvKzJtwb

Let's send a clear message to the world that women’s rights are human rights and that gender equality is central to all the #GlobalGoals. 

-- @antonioguterres at Monday's #CSW64 opening. https://t.co/6et19t2vgH https://t.co/UYGwJ8OGBS

🏠 Shelter

School meals ensure children are healthy, learn well, thrive and achieve their full potential.

@WFP -supported school feeding programmes are changing lives and boosting economic growth: https://t.co/EebqLRPkDK #GlobalGoals https://t.co/4glNlV8a3I

With operations in Central African Republic, Darfur, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Mali and South Sudan, see how @UNPeacekeeping disarmament efforts contribute to #SilencingtheGuns in Africa: https://t.co/mKFNO60cj9 https://t.co/46ntfBNpkB

With a little help, children can become the next generation of environmental heroes.

@FAO has simple ideas on how to encourage children to become #ClimateAction leaders. https://t.co/ZcFuEFUcWD

"Our world is in trouble, and gender equality is an essential part of the answer."

-- @antonioguterres on how bridging the gender power gap could help solve some of the most intractable global problems. https://t.co/FkSeIaaUZK

The number of migrant children crossing the jungle separating Colombia from Central America has increased nearly seven-fold.

50% of the children are under 6 years old. via @UNICEF https://t.co/yLOVk3IVVD

Across the world & across all sectors, women’s leadership continues to be underrepresented.

On Sunday's #InternationalWomensDay, show your support for breaking down barriers to equal participation. https://t.co/fJyFQoRro6 via @UN_Women https://t.co/0IlKWCScVu

"This patriarchal structure of society is still deeply rooted and needs to be very strongly shaken."

-- @antonioguterres' interview with the @nytimes about why all men should join the fight for women's rights - and why he's a proud feminist. https://t.co/7OFkGu5LxU
"On Sunday's International Women's Day, I call on everyone - men and women alike - to join the fight for gender equality." -- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/tTH6QPyAfy https://t.co/ke58GFMPbJ

Photography is a really powerful way to say that the sustainable development agenda is not just about development, it’s also about human rights.

--@UNYouthEnvoy on exhibit focusing on human rights challenges in Rio de Janeiro's slums. #StandUp4HumanRights
https://t.co/Xu9GKxwW3p

Not a single country has achieved gender equality yet.

There’s been progress, but real change is agonizingly slow.

On Sunday's #InternationalWomensDay, @UN_Women explains how YOU can help create the gender-equal world we all deserve. https://t.co/XUtQ6ggKSW https://t.co/5ef9Wk0ieV

"As a woman serving outside the borders of my country, I encourage all women to participate in @UNpeacekeeping." 

-- Major Samia Rehman from Pakistan, shares 8 things she loves about #ServingForPeace with @MONUSCO. #WomensDay
https://t.co/Tk16mgq7Sz

Sunday's #InternationalWomensDay is an opportunity to

☑️ challenge gender norms,
☑️ empower each other,
☑️ celebrate diversity,
☑️ break stereotypes,
☑️ mobilize and take action.

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/W08GAp2uh7 https://t.co/uwwDW2jQKY

Be kind to help reduce stigma & fear of #coronavirus.

🔹 Learn the facts
🔹 Support affected people
🔹 Share the stories of those who have recovered

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/Z8eRwZceTh #COVD19 https://t.co/N7in8XzFfL
Ahead of #InternationalWomensDay, take a listen 🎧 and learn more about why violence against women remains a major obstacle to achieving gender equality. https://t.co/OtE5rQbB5E

In the last two decades, the jaguar population has declined by 20-25% due to habitat loss, environmental degradation, poaching & illegal trade.

More on how @UNEP is working with partners to set up cross-border systems to protect jaguars. https://t.co/SM6ala2yE0

Every #ClimateAction counts! By bringing your own bag, you help reduce waste and plastic pollution.

#ActNow to protect our planet and all its people: https://t.co/0t01OVDMvC https://t.co/Jt7omJeScC
As we mourn the passing of former Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar, take a look back at some of his more memorable moments as head of the United Nations. https://t.co/KsJ321d0Tm

"With remote communities across islands, the geography of the Pacific makes the challenges of leaving no one behind so much bigger."

During his trip to Fiji, @UN_PGA discussed challenges and progress made towards achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/ShVCIufcV3 https://t.co/XsbCEWUEmE

Better data helps us track progress in achieving the #GlobalGoals.

UN Statistical Commission in NYC this week focused on ways to fill data gaps to ensure better lives for all. https://t.co/mTFo76WtBh https://t.co/YxtpNtByMo

The response to #coronavirus outbreak must take into account the needs of the most vulnerable, while protecting human dignity and people's rights, stresses @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet. https://t.co/PSo2W3EZwq #COVID19

"It is more important than ever for men to stand up for women’s rights and gender equality. That is why I am a proud feminist."

-- @antonioguterres ahead of #InternationalWomensDay. https://t.co/PZWYVYZWr4 https://t.co/V40Uq2b2Kt

Extreme floods exacerbated by the climate crisis will likely become more frequent.

More from @UNEP on the need for urgent #ClimateAction.

"When women enter spaces once dominated by men, it changes those spaces - bringing in new perspectives, correcting blind spots, & ultimately improving decision-making." 

-- @AminaJMohammed in new @Medium post on women in leadership.  https://t.co/XhHmnuXkVr

Millions of civilians remain trapped in northwest Syria, facing severe trauma and frigid temperatures.

UN humanitarian agencies are on the ground providing medical, food & child protection assistance. https://t.co/vPMIJ6mo7h https://t.co/vBdGnReDtB

AIDS remains leading cause of death for women of reproductive age due to gender inequality & violence, gaps in education, and lack of sexual & reproductive rights

New @UNAIDS report calls for greater investment in HIV policies that foster gender equality. https://t.co/e2LKDtrG84 https://t.co/gisEHt57gC

🔹 Be smart & inform yourself about #coronavirus
🔹 Be prepared
🔹 Be kind & support each other

📷: The "Good Defeats Evil" Sculpture at UNHQ depicts St. George slaying a dragon created from fragments of nuclear missiles.

For 50 years, the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty has been a central pillar of disarmament and international peace & security. https://t.co/vDJuaIaZf5 https://t.co/6gpxhgGhMo

Nearly 90% of men & women hold some sort of bias against women. 

@UNDP's latest Gender Social Norms Index reveal vast gender power gaps that still exist in economies, political systems, & corporations worldwide. https://t.co/kGY226iprd https://t.co/SAq4PD7gE0

Former Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar has passed away at the age of 100.

Information about his legacy and profound impact on the UN and the world: https://t.co/3Fkf7zA2EU https://t.co/IJy5gkBief

The #coronavirus outbreak has led to a slowdown in manufacturing and is disrupting world trade. 

A new @UNCTAD report analyzes potential long-term risks for the global economy. https://t.co/J3agwBH3Ln #COVID19 https://t.co/3RHPEeC2YS

South Sudan is moving toward sustainable peace, head of @unmissmedia tells Security Council.

Continued support from international community will be needed to achieve & maintain unity. https://t.co/JjP3yaikj9 https://t.co/2N81XkvGvX

"He was an accomplished statesman, a committed diplomat and a personal inspiration who left a profound impact on the United Nations and our world."

-- @antonioguterres on the passing of former Secretary-General Javier Pérez de Cuéllar https://t.co/GA1djrowKz https://t.co/wiYbdDPQ1X

Yemen: Escalating conflict & the ensuing humanitarian crises have left women & girls with insufficient access to basic services. 

@UNFPA is providing critical reproductive & psychological health services to thousands of vulnerable women. https://t.co/IDQLPjZO4S

For nearly 75 years, the UN has led global efforts to achieve peace, dignity and equality on a healthy planet.  

More on what we do: https://t.co/Nv4Czr835o #UN75 https://t.co/JdDpCzjvT3

The last Ebola patient has been discharged from a treatment centre in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. 

A 42-day countdown has begun to declare the end of the world's second-deadliest Ebola epidemic. https://t.co/inNZYioo7H 

https://t.co/58OP7NnOL4

More girls than ever are in school, but the world is still a violent & highly discriminatory place for them.

Greater efforts are needed to build a future where girls are safe, free to exercise their rights & have equal opportunities. #GenerationEquality
https://t.co/r7zJOgljY2

🍟🍦 Less fats and sugars
🥬🍊 More fruit and vegetables
🤸🚴 Regular physical activity

On Wednesday's #WorldObesityDay, @WHO has tips on how to maintain a healthy body: https://t.co/gPyjiC3b5z https://t.co/3zD6p6Dea5

Marida's inspiring story is a great example of how everyone of us can take #ClimateAction:

With support from @UNDP she and her neighbors have helped protect and replant Kakamega, the only rainforest in Kenya. https://t.co/qcvWMWkqsx

Globally, 35 million people suffer from drug use disorders.

The 63rd session of the Commission on Narcotic Drugs seeks to accelerate efforts to address the world drug problem. https://t.co/6mYrNZD9MC #CND2020 https://t.co/IYPIPO6kTe

As planting season begins, @FAO’s Keith Cressman explains how the locust outbreak affects farmers in East Africa.
Here's how swift action now can avert a humanitarian catastrophe: https://t.co/qoP15M897L

 https://t.co/BJH3ikBt7E

1 in 5 women & girls worldwide have experienced physical and/or sexual violence within the last year.

The UN-EU Spotlight Initiative aims to help eliminate all forms of violence against women & girls. https://t.co/Ej6NfxPhFg https://t.co/ik3VUqbnx3

After five months of protests in Iraq, political leaders have to act fast and place the country’s interest above all else, head of @UNIraq @JeanineHennis told Security Council on Tuesday. https://t.co/RLsKvibdZt https://t.co/Ul0HKvEL2t

Nearly 1 million species are in danger of extinction due to over-exploitation, the climate emergency & habitat degradation.

On #WorldWildlifeDay, @CITES explains how wildlife conservation can eliminate threats to biodiversity & benefit the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/R8m2D8lD0G https://t.co/wAeHSOkoAa

To respond to the needs of 855,000 Rohingya refugees living in exile in Bangladesh, @Refugees, @UNMigration & partners launched $877 million response plan to bolster protection & provide urgent humanitarian assistance. https://t.co/p6negJSUFT

"By overexploiting wildlife, habitats & ecosystems, humanity is endangering both itself and the survival of countless species of wild plants & animals."

-- On #WorldWildlifeDay, @antonioguterres calls for a more sustainable relationship with nature. https://t.co/r5MqQMU7Pc https://t.co/9iqvxBtBxD

Better data = better lives

Timely, high quality data & indicators are essential for achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

The UN Statistical Commission meets in New York this week for its 51st session. https://t.co/XlF45AML1x https://t.co/t8YAL5V8DV

Illegal wildlife trafficking
❌ contributes to loss of biodiversity
❌ threatens species with extinction
❌ leads to loss of income for local communities.

@UNODC works to #EndWildlifeCrime, on Tuesday's #WorldWildlifeDay and every day. https://t.co/q104IH5Txm https://t.co/NvhTEvzpIh

Syria: Violence & harsh winter conditions have put the lives of more than 1 million displaced people at risk, half of which are children. 

Unimpeded humanitarian access needed to save vulnerable civilians trapped in northwestern part of the country. 
https://t.co/sU84TMRIxT

Tuesday's #WorldWildlifeDay celebrates coral reefs and the millions of species they support.

Join @deespeak, find your kindred reef species and pledge to protect them.
https://t.co/oC1HjC1L8N #WildForLife via @UNEP https://t.co/khwd0Y9eeb

"Our aim is to contribute to efforts which will enable global economic & financial systems to work better for everyone, everywhere."

-- @UN_PGA launches High-level Panel on International Financial Accountability. https://t.co/mP2Ejt7EEd

An estimated 466 million people live with hearing loss. 
Many of the causes of hearing loss are preventable.

More from @WHO on Tuesday's #WorldHearingDay: https://t.co/Lt0aL8hwvK https://t.co/wmeTqJodG6

When women are targeted online, the abuse is likely to be sustained, sexualized and linked to offline violence.

Ending cyber misogyny and abuse starts with all of us. 

Tips from @UN_women on how YOU can help achieve #GenerationEquality: https://t.co/npz6E96klV https://t.co/cOOu3smMxZ

Over the last 40 years, the number of birds, fish, mammals, amphibians & reptiles has declined by nearly 60%.

Tuesday's #WorldWildlifeDay is an opportunity to seek solutions for creating more sustainable relationships between humans, nature & wildlife. https://t.co/tySvapX6ux https://t.co/ti2Y3RGXiF

.@UNSMILibya chief Ghassan Salamé planning to leave post as UN Envoy for Libya. 

Efforts are underway to ensure smooth leadership transition aimed at preserving momentum toward peace. https://t.co/NgDCuWvwEx

"Only through the equal participation of women can we benefit from the intelligence, experience and insights of all of humanity."

-- @antonioguterres calling for gender quality in his "Women and Power" speech. https://t.co/FPUHyszgln https://t.co/8qsqo2B1S7

$15 million has been released from @UNCERF to help fund global efforts to contain the #coronavirus.

The funds will help countries with fragile health systems boost their #COVID19 detection and response operations. https://t.co/T8beB33zri

1 in 3 women has experienced physical and/or sexual violence in her lifetime. 

The #GlobalsGoals aim to empower all women & girls and safeguard their future. https://t.co/pVP4nffFm3 https://t.co/tAcA0EY29u
Happening this week: #WorldWildlifeDay, #InternationalWomensDay and much more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cdxHx https://t.co/o7b7uwkR3x

“Gender equality is fundamentally a question of power." 

-- @antonioguterres called for gender equality as a prerequisite for a better world in his "Women and Power" speech this past week. https://t.co/FPUHysQRJX https://t.co/ijylUXjmRf

A woman's place is ... everywhere!

Join @UN_Women and the #GenerationEquality movement to support women's equality everywhere. https://t.co/pkuu5ZyARe https://t.co/gg4KOumRAu

Food labels guarantee that the food is what we think it is, and that products are as nutritious as we think they are.

@FAO explains 6 ways food labels are helping you: https://t.co/LFpG7kSjHE https://t.co/ngdcDGXYaC

During climate-related disasters, women and girls face a higher risk of exposure to sexual or gender-based violence and illness.

AIDS-related illnesses remain the leading cause of death among women of reproductive age. Stigma & discrimination risk the health, dignity & well-being of women & girls vulnerable to HIV.
